rComments: It was not really as bad as I was expecting. His lectures may seem more of a history class than politics but really it's just because of the content and not his teaching style. The final paper is challenging in the sense that you will need to put some real effort in there, but overall when your hard work pays off it feels great and you learn a lot!
By far the preachiest human being to walk the earth. Get ready for some cringy-worthy, biased, annoying lectures. If you don't want to major in polisci don't take this course.

Despite the course material being rather uninteresting, Hansen gave amazing lectures and had a really unique sense of humour that I appreciated. He comes off a little pompous but I think it adds to his charm. He also appears to be really knowledgeable.
His lectures are dense and boring. He doesn't seem passionate about anything he says and he comes off as quite pompous but other than that, the course work was pretty easy.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: One of the worst profs i ever had. More history than anything political. Only talks about himself.

Prof. Hansen is definitely  in top 3 professors I had during my academic career. He is very accessible outside of the classroom and he was able to help me when I needed his help the most. His professional qualities are also  topnotch. He gives good lectures and I like the selection of the reading materials for the class.

If you can overlook his smugness, Hansen is charismatic and his lectures are interesting. They are, however, disorganized, and finding the main points is a challenge. There are a lot of readings, most of which have no clear connection to lecture material, making studying a nightmare. I did learn a lot and his ideas are insightful.

Reasonable. Not afraid to say what he means, which can make him come across as a bit arrogant. Likes to put common views in perspective. Tries to be fair. You are expected to mostly talk about the readings in tutorial, not in lecture. Take this class if you're willing to look at things in a different way and explore other points of view.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Awesome prof, really great guy.
Awesome professor! Highly insightful, and will definitely try to challenge your views and beliefs. Extremely approachable, and will definitely try to help you (if you ask for help).

Not sure why Hansen gets so much hate here, but I thought he was a very interesting lecturer. All his main points were put on slides which were then posted online, so it was easy to keep track of his main arguments/information. Easy to stay awake in class because he makes the content relevant. Hope I can have him again for a political science class

Aside from his obvious arrogance, Hansen's lectures are confusing and the 2-hour class is usually only worth 30 minutes of real content (with his long pauses and tangents). He spends too much time on his own research. His readings range from important to irrelevant. Won't tell you what's on his test, expects you to just "know the readings".
teacherRatingTags: ['Graded by few things', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He's just plain arrogant and problematic.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Worst prof I ever had. Arrogant and demeaning, doesn't know how to make useful powerpoints. Never discusses the readings, only to go and test you on them. I know the course description for this class sounds interesting, but don't take it. You'll suffer I promise.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He is a fantastic and charismatic lecturer

Hansen was horrible. He would spend so much time talking about himself, emails he received and negotiating with students in the middle of con hall, we only had 30 minutes of content ever. His lectures and assignments lacked clarity, and he would change his stance on political happenings. Readings are never discussed just asked about on the exam.

He was funny and lively, but couldn't teach the course for his life. And the fact that we didn't have a textbook didn't help the matter. Being popular among students gets old pretty fast, especially when you can't teach for your life.
NEEDS TO MAKE CONNECTIONS TO THE READINGS (readings are never mentioned !!!)

As a professor he was awful. He only teaches from the European/North American perspective, and he speaks with the fake British accent. The person below is so right, he compares tragedies based on numbers, which is honestly gross. But as a person he's nice, if you go this office hours he's very friendly and will actually try to help you.

Hansen was the best professor I've had thus far. Being a hard marker and his choice of minimalistic PPTs were traits worth overlooking, since his lectures left me properly enlightened. He really wants his students to learn; I have never been so thoroughly convinced about how Europe represents the 'best and worst of humanity' before.

One of the best profs I've ever had. Inspirational, and incredibly smart. I wouldn't want to get into an argument with him, but he's a very reasonable guy. Very interesting lectures and content. He is very passionate about the political world and Europe in particular, and you really see it and come to appreciate it.
Professor Hansen is awesome - a great lecturer,  and always an exciting conclusion. He could use powerpoint more, but otherwise the best prof I've had.
I'll admit his lectures can be a bit boring but do the readings, go to lecture and you'll do well!
teacherRatingTags: ['EXTRA CREDIT', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Amazing lectures. He should gave more on his slides but an inspiring prof

This was the exam I probably studied the most for, and citing readings for the final exam was silly. He seems a little pretentious, and a lot of the course seemed focused around his own ideas.  Also the grading of papers/tests is heavily curved to achieve that magic average of 70%. That's not his fault, but it makes your effort feel useless.
Really hard. Crazy about citations. Don't take her courses .
Exam consists of readings (all 60 of em), lectures are aimless and confusing, and his lectures rely on his own thesis.

I found Randall Hansen's POL101 class a thoroughly entertaining and intellectually stimulating class. I thoroughly enjoyed it, and would recommend it to anyone. His sarcasm and sense of humor is extremely entertaining, and he is able to maintain the attention of over 1000 students every week. The class was pretty easy if you did your readings.
Dry lectures!
I did not like the way he lectures.
DO NOT TAKE POL101. You are going to  suffer. The lectures are so dry and the tutorials are boring.

Best lecturer ever, if you're lazy you're gonna have a tough time. If you don't do the reading or at least have background knowledge you will have problems. He's kind of difficult but very fair. I enjoyed his classes more than all my other ones. Great admiration for the man, frighteningly smart.
Confusing lectures,arrogant and minimal ppt. Confusing essay.
Lectures are confusing. He is not clear.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'So many papers', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Lectures were interesting, but power points are minimal and he talks fast.
Absolutely loved Hansen. His lectures were always really fun although his section of the midtermexam was tougher. Just make sure you do your readings and go for tutorial

I was really excited to take POL101. Hansen completely ruined it for me. He's an extremely pompous and arrogant man. I did not like his style of teaching at all. I don't understand why people are in love with him. He was neither helpful nor inspiring.

He had awesome lectures which were quite inspirational! But his slides were the worst with little to no information.  They contained only a title and rarely a few dates and that's all! I was planning to major in political science but he made me drop this course.  It was nice listening to him talk but he confused us a lot about the aim of thiscourse

At first Prof. Hansen will come off as very cocky, but as time goes on, you will realize that he's the King. While his powerpoints suck, his lectures are incredibly fascinating. He's more than willing to answer questions (in fact, he loves students that challenge him) but don't waste his time with nonsense. #HansenForPrimeMinister

Professor Hansen was okay. I really enjoyed his passion towards the topics he spoke about during lecture, but I couldn't always see the point he was arguing or trying to make.  I also just wish that he didn't go through the lecture slides as fast. As well, almost all of his lectures were related to war, and European Politics.
One of the most interesting professors at the university.  Brings a strong sense of passion towards the topic and its relation to the world.
Currently my favourite Prof at U of T

i don't think he knows what a ppt is ... he shows a blank page with a title (sometimes its 2 words) and when he does put up a nice slide he says "oh that was a mistake, you guys are getting this once and only once..." I'm a visual learner, thanks.

First few lectureshe comes off a little condescending and negative, but its more of a lecture personna. Hes super nice and approachable one on one, he's happy to talk to students. Lectures are very interesting & term tests are extremely specific to lectures and class materials.

Ive had this prof twice. He can be funny, and has interesting anecdotes but do note that he's a straight up jerk. Very arrogant, condescending & smug, can be blatantly unhelpful. Somewhat compensates this by being incredibly smart and organized during his lecture. He has incredibly high standards and very specific expectations. Not a nice guy.
The midterm had specific details which were impossible to study for. Focuses on parts of history that he likes/ goes off topic. Un-approachable.

Not helpful, pretty arrogant. A very intelligent man but he kept rubbing in that he was going to Cairo or Athens the next week for a conference. His tests did not reflect a lot of the material in class, and he never graded our papers or tests... some random TA did whom we had never seen before. Interesting material but unfair marking
Best prof I've had at UofT. Hands down.
Seems like a jerk... but ended up being ok - gave everyone decent marks. Be careful....

Prof. Hansen is one of the best profs I've had at U of T. Even in a large class, he truly values participation and makes the content interesting by incorporating current events into discussions. He balances teaching the bare bones of EU institutions with controversial issues. He is engaging, passionate yet objective, approachable & good humoured.
No Comments
Tries to be unreasonably hard.  Keeps emphasizing that he taught at Oxford.  So what?????
No Comments
just plain cocky.  makes you feel pathetic.

The most unapproachable prof I've ever had!  Despite being very intelligent, this prof truly makes you feel like a number....an insignificant one that is!  He's patronizing to his students, and doesn't even try to give the impression that he is trying to be helpful.  The class material is, however, intersting.
